Yes, the Catholic church is continuing to lose members and influence. That trend has been happening for years and it shows no sign of slowing down. The same goes for other christian churches, they are all in decline. According to Pew Research, only 22% of millennials attend church weekly or more. The millenials are currently of childbearing age. Since only 22% of them attend church weekly, that means that only one in five of their kids (Gen Z) are likely to be raised in a church. Of those Gen Z kids raised in a church, many of them will leave it as soon as they can. This means that by the time Gen Z is of childbearing age, vanishingly few of their kids will be raised in a church. By that time christianity may very well be dead for all intents and purposes
